articles.title: U.S. companies are expecting to pay an average 3.4% raise to workers in 2022 - CNBC
articles.description: Companies are increasing their budgets for pay raises as labor challenges continue, according to a new survey.
articles.content:
U.S. employers expect to pay an average 3.4% raise to their workers in 2022, according to a Willis Towers Watson survey.
That projected wage growth is faster than actual raises paid in the prior two… [+2578 chars]

articles.title: U.S. home builder sentiment dips; New York state factory activity plummets - Reuters
articles.description: Confidence among U.S. single-family homebuilders slipped in January after four straight monthly increases, and builders called for a new softwood lumber agreement with Canada to ease shortages and lower prices, a survey showed on Tuesday.
